mortality.note: Up to 1.5 million Circassians killed or expelled. 90% of population removed from homeland. Survivors deported to Ottoman Empire. Many died during forced marches and on overcrowded ships. Russia still does not recognize as genocide.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Russian military campaigns, forced deportations, destruction of villages. 90% of population killed or expelled.
rationales.profit: Land seizure for Russian settlers and military bases in North Caucasus.
rationales.ideology: Christian Russia vs Muslim Circassians, but primarily strategic territorial control.
rationales.complicity: Russian settlers occupied depopulated lands. Ottoman Empire accepted refugees but didn't intervene.

analysis.pattern_note: Largest ethnic cleansing in 19th century Europe. Russia wanted Circassian land for Russian settlers and to secure Caucasus. Entire villages burned, populations force-marched to Ottoman ports. Ubykh language now extinct. Georgia recognizes as genocide; Russia does not. Pattern: settler colonialism within contiguous empire rather than overseas.
analysis.root_causes: Russian imperial expansion, strategic Black Sea control, religious difference

sources.title: The Russian Conquest of the Caucasus
sources.author: John F. Baddeley
